title: Fairlight Walks

images.title: Julian P Guffogg / Visitor Centre, Fairlight Country Park
images.caption: Visitor Centre, Fairlight Country Park.

images.title: Simon Carey / Coastguard Lookout, Fire Hills
images.caption: Coastguard Lookout, Fire Hills. The highest peak of the Fire Hills has long been a vantage point to scan the open sea, the 19th century former coastguard cottages are out of view to the right of the current lookout. The highest point in Hastings, now named North's Seat, is at the top of Fairlight Down in Hastings Country Park. The spot is named after Frederick North (MP) who represented the town during the 19th century.

images.title: Shazz / Footpath to Fairlight Cove
images.caption: Footpath to Fairlight Cove. This was taken on the Sussex Coastline Walk. In the distance is the cliff at Fire Hills. The cove has suffered from coastal erosion and landslip at Rockmead Road and Sea Road. A number of houses there are very close to the sea edge, and properties on those roads suffered through demolition and abandonment of a number of homes.

images.title: Oast House Archive / Top of Fairlight Cliffs
images.caption: Top of Fairlight Cliffs

images.title: Nigel Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rip rap at Fairlight, Large Norwegian Granite boulders protect the village.

images.title: Janet Richardson / Royal Military Canal Pett Level East Sussex
images.caption: Royal Military Canal Pett Level East Sussex

images.title: Brian Whittle / Royal Military Canal near Wincelsea
images.caption: Royal Military Canal near Wincelsea

description: This East Sussex based village has some lovely coastal trails, a fine local country park and a canalside path for walkers to try. This walk from the village takes you to Fairlight Cove before following the Royal Military Canal Path to neighbouring Winchelsea. The walk starts from the car park and visitor centre at Fairlight. From here you head south to pick up the Saxon Shore Way and follow the waymarked footpath east through the splendid Firehills to Fairlight Cove. There's some excellent cliff tops sea views to enjoy around here. The route continues to Cliff End before turning north east along the Royal Military Canal. This easy trail will take you into Winchelsea where you will find a series of medieval buildings and several pubs for refreshment.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head west along the coast and you could explore more of the Hastings Country Park. For more walking ideas in the area see the Sussex Walks and the High Weald Walks pages.
